channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Hitting the road for Thanksgiving? Here's the best time to go
item.description: A record number of people are expected to travel within the U.S. for the holiday, according to AAA. Here are some weather and traffic factors to keep in mind.
item.content:encoded:
A record number of people are expected to travel within the U.S. for the holiday, according to AAA. Here are some weather and traffic factors to keep in mind.

(Image credit: Marta Lavandier)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Ukrainians react to a proposed peace plan that appears to favor Russia
item.description: Ukraine is under increasing pressure to agree to a peace deal American and Russian negotiators developed.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine is under increasing pressure to agree to a peace deal American and Russian negotiators developed.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: U.N. climate talks end without agreement on phasing out fossil fuels
item.description: Dozens of countries had called for a clear "roadmap" to transition away from the use of coal, oil and natural gas. The U.S. did not participate in the negotiations.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of countries had called for a clear "roadmap" to transition away from the use of coal, oil and natural gas. The U.S. did not participate in the negotiations.

(Image credit: Andre Penner)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: More than 300 children were abducted in an attack on a Catholic school in Nigeria
item.description: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.
item.content:encoded:
A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.

(Image credit: Christian Association of Nigeria)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro arrested for allegedly plotting escape ahead of prison term
item.description: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.
item.content:encoded:
Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.

(Image credit: Luis Nova)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: Jamal Khashoggi's words live forever
item.description: Jamal Khashoggi came from a prominent Saudi family but fled his country in June, 2017, after he'd become increasingly critical of his government. The Saudi journalist was murdered in 2018.
item.content:encoded:
Jamal Khashoggi came from a prominent Saudi family but fled his country in June, 2017, after he'd become increasingly critical of his government. The Saudi journalist was murdered in 2018.

(Image credit: Mohammed Al-Shaikh)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Meet the peace activist who persuaded France's Macron to recognize a Palestinian state
item.description: Israeli-French peace activist Ofer Bronchtein helped shape President Emmanuel Macron's plan to recognize a Palestinian state at the United Nations this year. Here's how he did it.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli-French peace activist Ofer Bronchtein helped shape President Emmanuel Macron's plan to recognize a Palestinian state at the United Nations this year. Here's how he did it.

(Image credit: Leonardo Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: How Marjorie Taylor Greene went from a top Trump ally to choosing to resign
item.description: Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene was one of President Trump's most outspoken supporters. But she is planning to leave office following a growing rift with the president.
item.content:encoded:
Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene was one of President Trump's most outspoken supporters. But she is planning to leave office following a growing rift with the president.

(Image credit: DANIEL HEUER)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Trump says he's terminating legal protections for Somali migrants in Minnesota
item.description: President Donald Trump said Friday night that he's "immediately" terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota. The state has the nation's largest Somali community.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump said Friday night that he's "immediately" terminating temporary legal protections for Somali migrants living in Minnesota. The state has the nation's largest Somali community.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Supreme Court blocks order that found Texas congressional map is likely racially biased
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
